intro: Rhodognaphalopsis duckei var. obtusifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaved sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and silver-gray foliage. The plant produces small, inconspicuous yellow flowers arranged in dense clusters, which bloom in the spring. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures. Due to its unique morphology and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
